events.name: WERQ™
events.content: Two Sessions: May 10 – June 28 and July 12 – August 30 FREE Trial Class Saturday May 3 Times: Saturdays 8:30 – 9:30am Cost: $15 dropin or $96 for eight-week session Students Should Bring: Supportive shoes and comfortable clothes you can move in Registration: Drop-in at door only.  Full session registration at door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Description: WERQ™ is the fiercely fun dance fitness workout class based on pop, rock, and hip-hop music taught by Certified Fitness Professionals.  The signature WERQ™ warmup previews the dance steps used in class and the signature WERQ™ cooldown includes balance and yoga inspired poses.  Are you ready to WERQ™? Instructor Bio:  Caeli is a certified personal trainer and fitness instructor with over 14 years of experience.  She loves working with a wide variety of clients and teaching a huge variety of classes, and she's earned over 15 fitness certifications.  She believes fitness can be more than just a workout, and specializes in bringing fun, fresh fitness classes like PILOXING and WERQ to her clients in Des Moines.  Her background in dance, yoga and Pilates helped her develop a unique training style which centers around functional training methods and training smaller, accessory muscles which traditional strength training often neglects.  She's excited to bring the high energy, calorie burning and awesome music of WERQ to the Des Moines Social Club! Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Acting I and II
events.content: Name: Acting I and II Orientation Class for Students new to the Meisner technique, or to working with James (no charge for this session): Saturday, May 3 Official Dates:  Saturdays May 10 – June 28 Times: 10:00am - 1:00pm Cost: $30 drop-in or $200 for eight-week session Registration: Drop-in payment at door only. Register for all classes at http://midwestix.securemytix.com/event/ActingIandII Students should bring: NA Description: Whether you are just starting out, or a seasoned professional looking to make your work even better, this class is specifically designed to take you further toward excellence in your actor’s journey.  While based on the teachings of Sanford Meisner, the class also makes use of many other exercises, insights and perspectives, including ones drawn from the instructor’s own wide-ranging background and experience as a stage and screen actor and as a teacher of acting.  The instructor will also bring in outside professionals to share their perspectives on the craft of acting and to respond to scene work. Instructor Bio:  James Serpento is one of the founding members of Kingman Row Entertainment, and has worked in the entertainment industry across the United States for more than three decades, with several hundreds of productions for stage and screen to his credit, many of them award-winning. As a director, he numbers among his favorite projects Los Angeles’ Eclectic Company Theatre’s Landscape of the Body, which included an LA Ovation Award-nominated performance by Daphne Ashbrook of Dr. Who fame; and Two Gentlemen of Verona, which was named a “Critics Choice” by the LA Times’  Robert Koehler, who called it “an exceptionally intelligent, impassioned reading of a tricky play.”  James has also directed Kaufman and Hart’s Once in a Lifetime for the Pasadena Shakespeare Company, and many other works in regional theatres around the Midwest (including Buried Life at the Chicago Directors Festival, and All My Sons, God of Carnage and Hughie at the Repertory Theater of Iowa.) His film directing includes four short pieces and the features The Yoofo Club and Haunting Villisca (the latter having been named Best Feature at the Iowa Independent Film Festival.) As an actor, James has worked extensively in theatre, film, commercials, and industrials around the Midwest, including Chicago, Indianapolis and Des Moines. Favorite roles include de Stogumber in St. Joan at Chicago’s Bailiwick Repertory, Teach in American Buffalo, Goldberg in The Birthday Party and Eddie in Fool for Love. He appears in the pilot episode of Bluebox Limited’s medical thriller, Spread, for MTV, as well as in their short film, Impulse. Other film appearances include The Final Season, Dead Awake, Sixteen to Life, Ash and, most recently, The Night Visitor. James was selected to assist with teaching acting while a student at Iowa State University; shortly thereafter, he spent a semester at ISU as a guest instructor.  A devoted student and teacher of the principles and methods espoused by Sanford Meisner, James has continued to study and teach acting alongside his own professional acting career, as both an independent instructor and as a faculty member at several academic and other institutions (including Indiana University, where he achieved his MFA in Acting, and Valparaiso University, where he was an assistant professor.) IMPORTANT NOTE:   We have accepted students down to the age of 12 into the class, but this is more the exception than the rule.  Some of the scenes we use contain adult language and themes and, while we allow students to "switch out" language they're uncomfortable with, we don't condone it since that's not how it works "in the real world" (where you're expected to do the script as written.)  Even if some students switch out language, others don't, so there's a likelihood that strong language will be heard (even if you're not the one saying it.)  If this is too great a difficulty for you, we certainly understand, but the class is not for you. Questions? Contact education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Charcoal Drawing
events.content: Saturdays May 10 - July 19 1:00 - 3:00pm (no class July 5) Cost: $200 for 10 week session Students Should Bring: Supply list will be sent to registered students in advance of first session Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page Description:  Have you ever wanted to learn how to draw? Are you OK with getting your hands dirty? This 10 week class will introduce you to basic drawing concepts and techniques with a focus on the use of charcoals and related mediums. Taught by local artist, Robert Reeves, you will learn to draw from observation using simple objects, complex still life arrangements, and live models. Open to all experience levels. Instructor Bio:  Robert Reeves was born in 1970 to a desperate runaway who sold him to gypsies who in turn traded him for a bag of seed corn, some magic beans, and a carton of Kools to a lovely couple from Waterloo, Iowa who raised him as their own.  He thus began his life in much the same way he was destined to live it: going several directions at once.  He received a BA in Art from the University of Northern Iowa in 1994 all while pursuing interests in film, theater, and music.  He has been creating and exhibiting Art for over 18 years. Working primarily from photos taken while chronicling his time spent walking and traveling Reeves draws and paints moments of personal significance and striking balance.  His painting style employs rough, energetic handling of the medium, deep contrasts, and highly saturated colors.  Scenes that appear to be photographic from a distance dissolve into masses of fervent brush strokes and splotches of paint. Building facades become washes. Figures become a slash of brush.  While the finished works appear to be plausibly genuine his process for arriving at the final composition is more organic: shifting figures and structures around to match the memory of the moment rather than remain fully within the constrains of reproduction. He seeks to move beyond the source and delve into his memory and emotions from the moment and bring it to the viewer. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Hip Hop Starz
events.content: Saturdays May 3 – June 7 and June 21 – July 26 1:30 – 2:30pm $50 for 6-week session Agest 5 and up Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page Description: Hip Hop is a blend of today's high-energy "street style" movement.  Typically performed to "popular urban music," this style of dance has been very sought after by teens, preteens and the "young at heart."  The style boasts that everyone is capable of taking part and having fun!  Sometimes percussive and other times it incorporates "house or club" dancing, making Hip Hop the latest dance phenomenon. Instructor Bio:  Yvette Keyes was born and raised in Des Moines, IA and received her dance education at Carol Tetmeyer Dance Studio. She began teaching competitive level dancing at the John R Grubb branch of the YMCA in 2002. Her team went on to win several special judges awards and choreography awards. events.name: Ballet Sculpt
events.content: Two Sessions: May 11 – June 29 and July 13 – August 31 FREE Trial Class Sunday May 4 Times: Sundays 9:00 – 10:00am Cost: $15 drop-in or $79 for eight-week session Students Should Bring: Socks, ballet slippers or soft soled dance shoes and a yoga mat. Registration: Drop in at door only.  Full session registration at door or through "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page. Description: Unleash your inner dancer and join us for a workout which will help you sculpt a longer, leaner you.  This ballet-inspired workout will help you develop your best body by stretching and working your muscles from head to toe.  Breath, stretch and flow through a workout which combines ballet, Pilates, body weight toning and more.  Whether you've always wished you did ballet, have spent years at the barre (or just want to look like you did), this is the perfect workout for you! Instructor Bio:  Caeli is a certified personal trainer and fitness instructor with over 14 years of experience.  She loves working with a wide variety of clients and teaching a huge variety of classes, and she's earned over 15 fitness certifications.  She believes fitness can be more than just a workout, and specializes in bringing fun, fresh fitness classes like PILOXING and WERQ to her clients in Des Moines.  Her background in dance, yoga and Pilates helped her develop a unique training style which centers around functional training methods and training smaller, accessory muscles which traditional strength training often neglects. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Teen Yoga
events.content: Sundays April 6 – June 15 12:00 – 1:00pm $10/class or 5 for $35 Students Should Bring: Yoga Mats, comfortable clothes Registration: Drop-in at door only.  5 class pack available at the door or at http://midwestix.securemytix.com/event/TeenYoga Description: Bring your teen to a class designed just for them. They'll work out the kinks, find their strength, tune into that laser-sharp focus, and learn to smile while balancing all that life throws at them. Taught by Mary Lasky, RYT, owner of Santosha Yoga Des Moines, and experienced teacher of kids and teens. (If your child has had Yoga for PE at middle school, most likely it was Mary teaching.)  Mats provided and all are welcome. Inquiries welcome at 515.333.3112 or wittierone@hotmail.com. More info on kids yoga available at santoshayogadsm.vpweb.com Instructor Bio:  Mary Lasky owns Santosha Yoga Des Moines and holds 200-hr RYTe certification through Yoga Alliance and Ashtanga Teacher Certification  through master teacher, David Swenson.  In accordance with the Ashtanga tradition, she continues her studies with master teachers each year. Mary has taught adults and children across the metro for ten years and particularly enjoys her work with at-risk youth and underserved adult populations.  She values yoga as an art form that crosses boundaries and connects people by first improving one's own health and outlook, and then opening them up to help others.  "Practice and all is coming." - Sri K. Pattabhi Jois, Ashtanga Founder Ages: 12 and up or with approval Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Page2Stage
events.content:
Page2Stage is the Des Moines Social Club’s monthly play reading series. Start time, and venue: 6 p.m. at Java Joe’s 4th Street Theatre. Regularly on the third Monday of the month. Every month we present a rehearsed reading of a great play—either brand new, an obscure old find, or something new to Des Moines.

Page2Stage: “Friendly Fire” by Sean Demers

The Third Monday in January: Jan. 20 at 7 p.m. FREE
Java Joe's 4th Street Theatre

Join us in January for a brand new script by a playwright currently in the University of Iowa's Playwright's Workshop. "Friendly Fire" is the story of David and Walter, two men whose job it is to guard a woman tied to a bed. They are not sure as to the reason for this job except that it involves bitter secrecy. The action takes place in a hotel room which is visited upon by a woman named Irene who is by turns maid, nurse, and accomplice. Irene shares secrets with both Walter and David.

Due to the serene nature of the job, David kills time by talking about seemingly inane b.s. to irritate or perhaps provoke Walter. As he spans the conversation from politics to patriotism to philosophy, Walter tries to take it all in stride, while he plots his own strategies.

"Friendly Fire" explores the nature and meaning of justice. The piece is inspired by our country’s struggle with the propriety of torture under the tenure of our 43rd president. The play also examines our fascination with captivity as well as our willingness to acquiesce to blind obedience.

Cast:
David: Brandon Brockshus
Walter: Jim Morrill
Irene: Marnie Strate

Directed by Elizabeth Riordan

events.name: Dance Trance
events.content: Dates: Ongoing beginning Tuesday, May 6 Times: Tuesdays and Fridays 6:00 – 7:00pm, Saturdays 3:00 – 4:00pm Cost: $12 drop-in or 12 classes for $125 Students Should Bring: water, a towel, and wear dance/workout gear and tennis shoes. Registration URL: Drop-in payment at door only.  12-class packs available at door or at http://midwestix.securemytix.com/event/DanceTrance Description: Dance Trance is a choreographed class that includes dance combinations and cardio moves so that you “sweat it” while you “shake it”! The purpose of this class is to get a great workout AND lose yourself in the rhythm.  It's not just exercise...it fills your soul!  You can tone and shape, build your cardiovascular endurance, and lose weight all while picking up some new dance moves! We consider our dance style more street dance and do not follow traditional dance standards or techniques. For that reason, students do not need to have a dance background, just determination and commitment to progress in a Dance Trance class. The more classes you attend the quicker you’ll learn the choreography!  You won't find another class where you have more fun while you're working out!  This class is for people who LOVE to dance.  More information at https://www.facebook.com/dancetrancedesmoines?ref=hl and http://dancetrancefitness.com/desmoines/ Instructor Bio:  Jamie Shae is a mother of two, a native Iowan and an artist at heart.  As Jamie continued to seek ways to be healthy in mind, body, and spirit, she came across Dance Trance Fitness and knew instantly this was something special.  Jamie has always been an athlete - everything from gymnastics, dance, softball, to kickboxing - but she never really loved working out until she found Dance Trance Fitness.  Now she wants to share her newfound love with others to create a community of men and women supporting each other, both on and off the dance floor. Ages: Recommended for 16 and up.  Some music contains explicit lyrics. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Lunch Hour Yoga
events.content: Tuesdays and Thursdays beginning April 10 Times: 12:00 – 12:45pm Cost: $10 drop-in, 5 for $45, or 10 for $80 Students Should Bring: Yoga Mats Registration: Drop-in payment at door only.   Five and Ten Class Packs available at door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Description: Join us on your lunch hour for a rejuvenating 45 minute yoga session. Geared toward all levels, this class is intended to wake up your senses and energize you for the afternoon. Instructors:  Elise Goodmann (Tuesdays), Mary Lasky (Thursdays) Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Break Dancing for Kids
events.content: Tuesdays May 6 – July 8 7:15 – 8:15pm $15 drop-in or $120 for 10 weeks All ages welcome Registration : Drop-in at door only.  Full session registration at door or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page. Description: A beginner breakdancing class teaching the basic foundation of the dance along with history of the Hip Hop culture. This class will cover basic toprocking, footwork, freezes, transitions, and power in a fun and safe environment. Instructor Bio:  Anthony San has been breakdancing for over 5 years, since March of 2008, after being influenced by local dancers in Floor Spiders Crew. Her has performed in breakdancing competitions in Iowa, Kansas City, Saint Louis, Omaha, and other cities in the Midwest since 2009, and performing locally at events such as CelebrAsian 2010-2011, IMMAWII 2011, Iowa Youth Congress 2011, ISU Latin Fest 2011, Convoy of Hope 2011, ArtFest 2012, and Minorities on the Move 2012-2013. I've also street performed in Leipzig, Germany and competed in Chemnitz, Germany. Anthony was in the "Ancient Astronauts" music video for Tuff Gong ft. Martin Perna, as well as a cameo in the music video for Maxilla Blue's "Lego Blocks". He was featured in Juice Magazine and The Des Moines Register in 2013.  He has been working the youth in Des Moines, by showing them that this dance is also an outlet and it can help them express themselves. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Yoga I and II
events.content: Ongoing Times: 6:30 - 7:15am Cost: $10 drop-in, 5 classes for $45, 10 classes for $80 Registration: Drop-in payment at door only.  Five and Ten-class Packs available at the door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" in upper right corner of this page. Students should bring: Yoga Mats Description: Through the practice of yoga we learn to let go so that we may truly live. Be the catalyst for your own life.  Take this challenging and thought provoking class that will leave you feeling renewed, refreshed, and ready for the world!  Designed for beginners or advanced students. Instructor Bio:  Deirdre Lane completed yoga teacher training in 2005 at The Sanctuary in Koh Phangan, Thailand. Since then she has taught classes for kids and adults in San Diego, California and Des Moines, Iowa. She works at the Principal Financial Group as an IT Business Analyst. She teaches yoga through PlusOne at Principal and Wellmark. She is currently completing her MBA at Drake University. You will often see her riding around town on her pretty white bicycle ringing the red bell to say hello. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Creative Movement for Ages 2 - 4
events.content: Wednesdays April 30 – June 4 and June 18 – July 23 $40 for 6-week session Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page. Description: This is a stimulating, fun and imaginative class that introduces the fundamentals of dance while nurturing a child’s agility and musicality. Students learn classroom procedures – student/teacher relationship; taking turns; participation and co-operation. By using games, props, toys and rhythm instruments, the class offers creative ways to challenge the child both mentally and physically. Instructor Bio:  Yvette Keyes was born and raised in Des Moines, IA and received her dance education at Carol Tetmeyer Dance Studio. She began teaching competitive level dancing at the John R Grubb branch of the YMCA in 2002. Her team went on to win several special judges awards and choreography awards. In the fall of 2002 she went into business for herself opening up Yvette’s Dance Studio. At Yvette’s Dance Studio she taught tap, ballet, jazz, hip-hop, contemporary and basic tumbling to dancers ages 3 and up. She also continued to expand her competition team winning the top award for large groups at Talent On Parade in 2006. She was the first large group to ever claim that award over all the other disciplines of dance with a hip-hop number. Along with teaching at her own studio she also choreographed for Meredith Middle School, Roosevelt High Schools Sensational Elite Dance Team and North High School Dance Team. Her dancers have been seen performing at their annual recital and outside performances as well at I’ll Make Me a World in Iowa, The Iowa State Fair, The Christmas Show at Park Fair Mall. Yvette has also volunteered her time teaching students at the Boys & Girls Club and other various organizations. Yvette is currently owner of Diamond Dance Center and still teaching dance. Yvette continues to attend an annual teacher conference in Chicago, IL yearly to update her teaching skills and get new ideas for the business side of her studio. Her passion for dance makes her determined to continue to pass the love of dance onto generations to come. Ages: 2-4 Years Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Painting with Acrylics I
events.content: Wednesdays May 14 – June 18 6:30 – 8:00pm Cost: $115 for six-week session Students Should Bring: Supply lists will be sent to registered students in advance of class Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Description: Students will learn fundamental techniques of acrylic painting. Any skill level can benefit from this class, from beginner to advanced. Students will learn techniques using the brush and other tools to apply paint, as well as how to mix and use color. By the end of the class students will have completed a painting based on the subject matter and style of their choosing. Instructor Bio:  Bill Hamilton was born in Des Moines, IA in 1976 to two professional nationally recognized artists, Gene and Carlie Hamilton. He attended the Academy of Art in San Francisco and mentored with artist Jim Buckels.  He has shown work in several solo exhibitions and group exhibitions in the U.S. and abroad since 2000 starting with his first solo exhibition of paintings in the Republic of Georgia.  Bill has also done murals for private homes and businesses such as Holiday Inn, Special Olympics, Des Moines Arts Festival and more.  He has taught art all over central Iowa over the years for kids and adults. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Everything Circus
events.content: May 7 – June 11 Wednesdays 7:00 - 8:30pm Cost: $20 drop-in, 6-week session for $110 Registration: Drop-in at door only.  Register for full course by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Students should bring: Athletic shoes and clothes that are easy to move in. Description: Want to learn amazing new skills and invigorate your fitness routine? Perfect for adults of all ages and fitness levels. Circus is a great way to improve body balance, strength, flexibility, and coordination. Your body AND mind will get a work out! We will explore several varieties of circus props and apparatus from juggling, to hula hooping, acrobatics and even aerial arts! This is great way to learn a little bit of everything circus.  No experience is necessary, simply a curiosity for all things circus. Classes are individualized to your needs and strengths. Come and learn circus arts right here in Des Moines from a real full-time circus performer. Space is limited. Those who pre-register will be given preference. Instructor Bio: It started innocently enough- learning to juggle for a middle school play in her small Iowa hometown. Several years later, Laura has become an international award-winning performer that has made a career out of her passion for entertaining and teaching. She has taught Circus Arts all over the world, from mission trips in Guatemala, to After School Programs in Washing D.C., and the Circus Smirkus Youth Circus. Laura has years of experience teaching all ages and levels of skill and is dedicated to providing safe and professional circus instruction. Ages: 16 and up Qestions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: American Tribal Style® Belly Dance Level 2
events.content: Twelve-week course taught in two sessions: May 15 – June 19, July 10 – August 14 Times: Thursdays 7:30 – 8:30pm Cost: $15 drop-in or $60 for six-week session Registration: Drop-in payment at door only.  Full session registration at door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" in upper right corner of this page. Students should bring: Snug-fitting, comfortable clothes Description: In Level 2 we will add to and expand upon the foundation moves that were learned in level 1 by layering, levels, new moves, new zill patterns, and performance techniques that will really get students dancing.  Students will need to have completed two sessions of level 1 or have the consent of the instructor to enter level 2. Level 2 contains twelve weeks of instruction, which will be held in two six-week sessions. All classes are taught by a certified instructor and FCBD® Sister Studio. Instructor Bio:  Dawn Grey is an American Tribal Style® Belly Dancer, Certified Instructor, Fat Chance Belly Dance® Sister Studio, and the Director of Blissful Sunrise Belly Dance. She has had a love of dance almost since before she could walk.  She has been trained in ballet, tap, and jazz dance throughout her childhood, teens, and as a dance major in college.  Then life stepped in.  She is a devoted wife and mother of two who stopped dancing to get a job with health insurance.  Fourteen years later she realized something was missing.  It was then that she found ATS® Belly Dance and fell in love.  She has not stopped since and loves to share her passion with others. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: American Tribal Style® Belly Dance - Level 1
events.content: American Tribal Style® Belly Dance Current Session: February 6 - March 20 (extended one week to account for weather cancelation) Upcoming Sessions:  Thursday, March 27 - Thursday, May 1 May 15 - June 19 July 10 - August 14 Times: Thursdays 6:15 – 7:15pm Cost: $15 drop-in or $60 for six-week session Registration: www.midwestix.securemytix.com/event/AmericanTribalStyleBellyDance Students should bring: Snug-fitting, comfortable clothes Description: This six-week session is for students who have never tried ATS® Belly Dance or for advanced students who want to refine their foundational moves.  This dance style was originated by Carolena Nericcio-Bohlman right here in the United States.  The combination of colorful costumes, adornments, coordinated movements, and a totally improvisational style, make this dance a fun and exciting venture. This class is appropriate for any ages (18-118), all sizes and fitness levels.  No prior dance experience is needed and no, you are not required to show your belly.  All you need is a willingness to learn, meet great people, and to have a lot of fun.  We will have you dancing in your very first class. Instructor Bio:  Dawn Grey is an American Tribal Style® Belly Dancer, Certified Instructor, Fat Chance Belly Dance® Sister Studio, and the Director of Blissful Sunrise Belly Dance. She has had a love of dance almost since before she could walk.  She has been trained in ballet, tap, and jazz dance throughout her childhood, teens, and as a dance major in college.  Then life stepped in.  She is a devoted wife and mother of two who stopped dancing to get a job with health insurance.  Fourteen years later she realized something was missing.  It was then that she found ATS® Belly Dance and fell in love.  She has not stopped since and loves to share her passion with others. FAQ’s: Q: Am I too old, large, out of shape, etc., etc. for belly dance? A: Absolutely not.  This dance is appropriate for all.  I have had students of all shapes and sizes and students in their twenties as well as students in their seventies.  If you have thought about it and then talked yourself out of it for any reason, now is your chance to give it a whirl in a fun and supportive environment.  If you have health concerns, we ask that your consult your physician before participating in any physical activity, but generally we can make modifications to suit your needs. Q: What should I wear/bring to class? A: You should wear something comfortable that you can move in.  Generally yoga pants or sweats with a tank top or snug fitting T-shirt are fine.  If you like you can wear a long flowing skirt. We usually dance barefoot, but if you need or want shoes, you will need some that do not have too much traction (dance shoes are good) and have not been worn outside in order to protect the integrity of the dance floor. Bring a water bottle for hydration and by week 3 you will need a set of zills (finger cymbals).  We will talk about this more on the first day of class. Q: Do I have to dance in front of other people? A: Well, there most likely will be other students, and of course, the instructor in your class; however, other than that, no.  There will be performance opportunities available for students who want to go that route, but you never have to perform if you do not want to.  Some people are content to just come to class once a week, have a great time, dance off some stress, and then get on with the rest of their lives.  That is perfectly ok. Questions? Email info@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: WERQ™
events.content: Two Sessions: May 10 – June 28 and July 12 – August 30 FREE Trial Class Saturday May 3 Times: Saturdays 8:30 – 9:30am Cost: $15 dropin or $96 for eight-week session Students Should Bring: Supportive shoes and comfortable clothes you can move in Registration: Drop-in at door only.  Full session registration at door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Description: WERQ™ is the fiercely fun dance fitness workout class based on pop, rock, and hip-hop music taught by Certified Fitness Professionals.  The signature WERQ™ warmup previews the dance steps used in class and the signature WERQ™ cooldown includes balance and yoga inspired poses.  Are you ready to WERQ™? Instructor Bio:  Caeli is a certified personal trainer and fitness instructor with over 14 years of experience.  She loves working with a wide variety of clients and teaching a huge variety of classes, and she's earned over 15 fitness certifications.  She believes fitness can be more than just a workout, and specializes in bringing fun, fresh fitness classes like PILOXING and WERQ to her clients in Des Moines.  Her background in dance, yoga and Pilates helped her develop a unique training style which centers around functional training methods and training smaller, accessory muscles which traditional strength training often neglects.  She's excited to bring the high energy, calorie burning and awesome music of WERQ to the Des Moines Social Club! Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Acting I and II
events.content: Name: Acting I and II Orientation Class for Students new to the Meisner technique, or to working with James (no charge for this session): Saturday, May 3 Official Dates:  Saturdays May 10 – June 28 Times: 10:00am - 1:00pm Cost: $30 drop-in or $200 for eight-week session Registration: Drop-in payment at door only. Register for all classes at http://midwestix.securemytix.com/event/ActingIandII Students should bring: NA Description: Whether you are just starting out, or a seasoned professional looking to make your work even better, this class is specifically designed to take you further toward excellence in your actor’s journey.  While based on the teachings of Sanford Meisner, the class also makes use of many other exercises, insights and perspectives, including ones drawn from the instructor’s own wide-ranging background and experience as a stage and screen actor and as a teacher of acting.  The instructor will also bring in outside professionals to share their perspectives on the craft of acting and to respond to scene work. Instructor Bio:  James Serpento is one of the founding members of Kingman Row Entertainment, and has worked in the entertainment industry across the United States for more than three decades, with several hundreds of productions for stage and screen to his credit, many of them award-winning. As a director, he numbers among his favorite projects Los Angeles’ Eclectic Company Theatre’s Landscape of the Body, which included an LA Ovation Award-nominated performance by Daphne Ashbrook of Dr. Who fame; and Two Gentlemen of Verona, which was named a “Critics Choice” by the LA Times’  Robert Koehler, who called it “an exceptionally intelligent, impassioned reading of a tricky play.”  James has also directed Kaufman and Hart’s Once in a Lifetime for the Pasadena Shakespeare Company, and many other works in regional theatres around the Midwest (including Buried Life at the Chicago Directors Festival, and All My Sons, God of Carnage and Hughie at the Repertory Theater of Iowa.) His film directing includes four short pieces and the features The Yoofo Club and Haunting Villisca (the latter having been named Best Feature at the Iowa Independent Film Festival.) As an actor, James has worked extensively in theatre, film, commercials, and industrials around the Midwest, including Chicago, Indianapolis and Des Moines. Favorite roles include de Stogumber in St. Joan at Chicago’s Bailiwick Repertory, Teach in American Buffalo, Goldberg in The Birthday Party and Eddie in Fool for Love. He appears in the pilot episode of Bluebox Limited’s medical thriller, Spread, for MTV, as well as in their short film, Impulse. Other film appearances include The Final Season, Dead Awake, Sixteen to Life, Ash and, most recently, The Night Visitor. James was selected to assist with teaching acting while a student at Iowa State University; shortly thereafter, he spent a semester at ISU as a guest instructor.  A devoted student and teacher of the principles and methods espoused by Sanford Meisner, James has continued to study and teach acting alongside his own professional acting career, as both an independent instructor and as a faculty member at several academic and other institutions (including Indiana University, where he achieved his MFA in Acting, and Valparaiso University, where he was an assistant professor.) IMPORTANT NOTE:   We have accepted students down to the age of 12 into the class, but this is more the exception than the rule.  Some of the scenes we use contain adult language and themes and, while we allow students to "switch out" language they're uncomfortable with, we don't condone it since that's not how it works "in the real world" (where you're expected to do the script as written.)  Even if some students switch out language, others don't, so there's a likelihood that strong language will be heard (even if you're not the one saying it.)  If this is too great a difficulty for you, we certainly understand, but the class is not for you. Questions? Contact education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Charcoal Drawing
events.content: Saturdays May 10 - July 19 1:00 - 3:00pm (no class July 5) Cost: $200 for 10 week session Students Should Bring: Supply list will be sent to registered students in advance of first session Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page Description:  Have you ever wanted to learn how to draw? Are you OK with getting your hands dirty? This 10 week class will introduce you to basic drawing concepts and techniques with a focus on the use of charcoals and related mediums. Taught by local artist, Robert Reeves, you will learn to draw from observation using simple objects, complex still life arrangements, and live models. Open to all experience levels. Instructor Bio:  Robert Reeves was born in 1970 to a desperate runaway who sold him to gypsies who in turn traded him for a bag of seed corn, some magic beans, and a carton of Kools to a lovely couple from Waterloo, Iowa who raised him as their own.  He thus began his life in much the same way he was destined to live it: going several directions at once.  He received a BA in Art from the University of Northern Iowa in 1994 all while pursuing interests in film, theater, and music.  He has been creating and exhibiting Art for over 18 years. Working primarily from photos taken while chronicling his time spent walking and traveling Reeves draws and paints moments of personal significance and striking balance.  His painting style employs rough, energetic handling of the medium, deep contrasts, and highly saturated colors.  Scenes that appear to be photographic from a distance dissolve into masses of fervent brush strokes and splotches of paint. Building facades become washes. Figures become a slash of brush.  While the finished works appear to be plausibly genuine his process for arriving at the final composition is more organic: shifting figures and structures around to match the memory of the moment rather than remain fully within the constrains of reproduction. He seeks to move beyond the source and delve into his memory and emotions from the moment and bring it to the viewer. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Hip Hop Starz
events.content: Saturdays May 3 – June 7 and June 21 – July 26 1:30 – 2:30pm $50 for 6-week session Agest 5 and up Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page Description: Hip Hop is a blend of today's high-energy "street style" movement.  Typically performed to "popular urban music," this style of dance has been very sought after by teens, preteens and the "young at heart."  The style boasts that everyone is capable of taking part and having fun!  Sometimes percussive and other times it incorporates "house or club" dancing, making Hip Hop the latest dance phenomenon. Instructor Bio:  Yvette Keyes was born and raised in Des Moines, IA and received her dance education at Carol Tetmeyer Dance Studio. She began teaching competitive level dancing at the John R Grubb branch of the YMCA in 2002. Her team went on to win several special judges awards and choreography awards. In the fall of 2002 she went into business for herself opening up Yvette’s Dance Studio. At Yvette’s Dance Studio she taught tap, ballet, jazz, hip-hop, contemporary and basic tumbling to dancers ages 3 and up. She also continued to expand her competition team winning the top award for large groups at Talent On Parade in 2006. She was the first large group to ever claim that award over all the other disciplines of dance with a hip-hop number. Along with teaching at her own studio she also choreographed for Meredith Middle School, Roosevelt High Schools Sensational Elite Dance Team and North High School Dance Team. Her dancers have been seen performing at their annual recital and outside performances as well at I’ll Make Me a World in Iowa, The Iowa State Fair, The Christmas Show at Park Fair Mall. Yvette has also volunteered her time teaching students at the Boys & Girls Club and other various organizations. Yvette is currently owner of Diamond Dance Center and still teaching dance. Yvette continues to attend an annual teacher conference in Chicago, IL yearly to update her teaching skills and get new ideas for the business side of her studio. Her passion for dance makes her determined to continue to pass the love of dance onto generations to come.   Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Dance Trance
events.content: Ongoing beginning Tuesday, May 6 Times: Tuesdays and Fridays 6:00 – 7:00pm, Saturdays 3:00 – 4:00pm Cost: $12 drop-in or 12 classes for $125 Students Should Bring: water, a towel, and wear dance/workout gear and tennis shoes. Registration: Drop-in payment at door only.  12 class packs available at door or at http://midwestix.securemytix.com/event/DanceTrance Description: Dance Trance is a choreographed class that includes dance combinations and cardio moves so that you “sweat it” while you “shake it”! The purpose of this class is to get a great workout AND lose yourself in the rhythm.  It's not just exercise...it fills your soul!  You can tone and shape, build your cardiovascular endurance, and lose weight all while picking up some new dance moves! We consider our dance style more street dance and do not follow traditional dance standards or techniques. For that reason, students do not need to have a dance background, just determination and commitment to progress in a Dance Trance class. The more classes you attend the quicker you’ll learn the choreography!  You won't find another class where you have more fun while you're working out!  This class is for people who LOVE to dance.  More information at https://www.facebook.com/dancetrancedesmoines?ref=hl and http://dancetrancefitness.com/desmoines/ Instructor Bio:  Jamie Shae is a mother of two, a native Iowan and an artist at heart.  As Jamie continued to seek ways to be healthy in mind, body, and spirit, she came across Dance Trance Fitness and knew instantly this was something special.  Jamie has always been an athlete - everything from gymnastics, dance, softball, to kickboxing - but she never really loved working out until she found Dance Trance Fitness.  Now she wants to share her newfound love with others to create a community of men and women supporting each other, both on and off the dance floor. Ages: Recommended for 16 and up.  Some music contains explicit lyrics. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Ballet Sculpt
events.content: Two Sessions: May 11 – June 29 and July 13 – August 31 FREE Trial Class Sunday May 4 Times: Sundays 9:00 – 10:00am Cost: $15 drop-in or $79 for eight-week session Students Should Bring: Socks, ballet slippers or soft soled dance shoes and a yoga mat. Registration: Drop in at door only.  Full session registration at door or through "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page. Description: Unleash your inner dancer and join us for a workout which will help you sculpt a longer, leaner you.  This ballet-inspired workout will help you develop your best body by stretching and working your muscles from head to toe.  Breath, stretch and flow through a workout which combines ballet, Pilates, body weight toning and more.  Whether you've always wished you did ballet, have spent years at the barre (or just want to look like you did), this is the perfect workout for you! Instructor Bio:  Caeli is a certified personal trainer and fitness instructor with over 14 years of experience.  She loves working with a wide variety of clients and teaching a huge variety of classes, and she's earned over 15 fitness certifications.  She believes fitness can be more than just a workout, and specializes in bringing fun, fresh fitness classes like PILOXING and WERQ to her clients in Des Moines.  Her background in dance, yoga and Pilates helped her develop a unique training style which centers around functional training methods and training smaller, accessory muscles which traditional strength training often neglects. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Teen Yoga
events.content: Sundays April 6 – June 15 12:00 – 1:00pm $10/class or 5 for $35 Students Should Bring: Yoga Mats, comfortable clothes Registration: Drop-in at door only.  5 class pack available at the door or at http://midwestix.securemytix.com/event/TeenYoga Description: Bring your teen to a class designed just for them. They'll work out the kinks, find their strength, tune into that laser-sharp focus, and learn to smile while balancing all that life throws at them. Taught by Mary Lasky, RYT, owner of Santosha Yoga Des Moines, and experienced teacher of kids and teens. (If your child has had Yoga for PE at middle school, most likely it was Mary teaching.)  Mats provided and all are welcome. Inquiries welcome at 515.333.3112 or wittierone@hotmail.com. More info on kids yoga available at santoshayogadsm.vpweb.com Instructor Bio:  Mary Lasky owns Santosha Yoga Des Moines and holds 200-hr RYTe certification through Yoga Alliance and Ashtanga Teacher Certification  through master teacher, David Swenson.  In accordance with the Ashtanga tradition, she continues her studies with master teachers each year. Mary has taught adults and children across the metro for ten years and particularly enjoys her work with at-risk youth and underserved adult populations.  She values yoga as an art form that crosses boundaries and connects people by first improving one's own health and outlook, and then opening them up to help others.  "Practice and all is coming." - Sri K. Pattabhi Jois, Ashtanga Founder Ages: 12 and up or with approval Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Advanced Figure Drawing
events.content: Every other Sunday beginning April 27 3:30 – 5:00pm $10 at the door BYOE (Bring Your Own Easel), limited tabletop easels will be available Description: Advanced Figure Drawing will be a bi-weekly life drawing session with experienced models. The aim of this workshop is to provide the experienced artist with time and space to develop their skills and techniques in life drawing. There will be an optional period of critique near the end of each session. Artists must bring their own materials, including an easel (if you wish to use one). For more information email Jon Pearson at pearsonable2@gmail.com Instructor Bio:  Jon Pearson is a Des Moines artist. He has shown extensively in the region and taught numerous workshops and classes in drawing and painting. View his work at http://jonathanpearson.4ormat.com/ Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Beginning Poi
events.content: Fourth Sunday of every month beginning April 27 Times: 7:00 – 8:00pm Cost: $15 drop-in only Students Should Bring: Comfortable clothes.  Poi will be provided. Description: No experience needed for this beginner workshop in which we will explore the basics of spinning poi!  Spinning Poi helps one gain and/or improve dexterity, hand-eye-coordination, strength, and rhythm, but it's main purpose, both historically and now, is to have fun! Instructor Bio:  Lacey Cornick has been practicing the Maori art of Poi for 6 years and currently spins traditional, LED, and fire Poi with Des Moines’ own performing troupe, Professor Prometheus's Combustible Circus. Spinning Poi helps one gain and/or improve dexterity, hand-eye-coordination, strength, and rhythm, but it's main purpose, both historically and now, is to have fun! As a teacher, Lacey is casual, friendly, enthusiastic, and always looks forward to meeting new students. Ages: 14 and up Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Firejam
events.content: Fourth Sunday of every month beginning April 27 Times: 8:00 – 11:00pm Cost: Free-will donation to DMSC Students Should Bring: Wear natural fabrics and tie back long hair. Avoid fraying clothing or synthetic fabrics.  Bring your own props, and we will provide the fuel.  Description:  Des Moines Fire Jam is a community of local fire dancers and spinners.  Fire Jam provides a safe and supportive environment to explore the fire flow arts.  Whether you are an experienced spinner, developing novice, or curious onlooker, all are welcome to join us in the courtyard.  All participants must be 18 or older and will be required to take the fire safety course on site before lighting.  All ages are welcome as an audience though children must be under adult supervision at all times.  We follow all NAFAA guidelines. Ages: 18 and up to participate, child spectators must be under adult supervision Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Dance Trance
events.content: Dates: Ongoing beginning Tuesday, May 6 Times: Tuesdays and Fridays 6:00 – 7:00pm, Saturdays 3:00 – 4:00pm Cost: $12 drop-in or 12 classes for $125 Students Should Bring: water, a towel, and wear dance/workout gear and tennis shoes. events.name: Lunch Hour Yoga
events.content: Tuesdays and Thursdays beginning April 10 Times: 12:00 – 12:45pm Cost: $10 drop-in, 5 for $45, or 10 for $80 Students Should Bring: Yoga Mats Registration: Drop-in payment at door only.   Five and Ten Class Packs available at door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Description: Join us on your lunch hour for a rejuvenating 45 minute yoga session. Geared toward all levels, this class is intended to wake up your senses and energize you for the afternoon. Instructors:  Elise Goodmann (Tuesdays), Mary Lasky (Thursdays) Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Break Dancing for Kids
events.content: Tuesdays May 6 – July 8 7:15 – 8:15pm $15 drop-in or $120 for 10 weeks All ages welcome Registration : Drop-in at door only.  Full session registration at door or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page. Description: A beginner breakdancing class teaching the basic foundation of the dance along with history of the Hip Hop culture. This class will cover basic toprocking, footwork, freezes, transitions, and power in a fun and safe environment. Instructor Bio:  Anthony San has been breakdancing for over 5 years, since March of 2008, after being influenced by local dancers in Floor Spiders Crew. Her has performed in breakdancing competitions in Iowa, Kansas City, Saint Louis, Omaha, and other cities in the Midwest since 2009, and performing locally at events such as CelebrAsian 2010-2011, IMMAWII 2011, Iowa Youth Congress 2011, ISU Latin Fest 2011, Convoy of Hope 2011, ArtFest 2012, and Minorities on the Move 2012-2013. I've also street performed in Leipzig, Germany and competed in Chemnitz, Germany. Anthony was in the "Ancient Astronauts" music video for Tuff Gong ft. Martin Perna, as well as a cameo in the music video for Maxilla Blue's "Lego Blocks". He was featured in Juice Magazine and The Des Moines Register in 2013.  He has been working the youth in Des Moines, by showing them that this dance is also an outlet and it can help them express themselves. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Yoga I and II
events.content: Ongoing Times: 6:30 - 7:15am Cost: $10 drop-in, 5 classes for $45, 10 classes for $80 Registration: Drop-in payment at door only.  Five and Ten-class Packs available at the door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" in upper right corner of this page. Students should bring: Yoga Mats Description: Through the practice of yoga we learn to let go so that we may truly live. Be the catalyst for your own life.  Take this challenging and thought provoking class that will leave you feeling renewed, refreshed, and ready for the world!  Designed for beginners or advanced students. Instructor Bio:  Deirdre Lane completed yoga teacher training in 2005 at The Sanctuary in Koh Phangan, Thailand. Since then she has taught classes for kids and adults in San Diego, California and Des Moines, Iowa. She works at the Principal Financial Group as an IT Business Analyst. She teaches yoga through PlusOne at Principal and Wellmark. She is currently completing her MBA at Drake University. You will often see her riding around town on her pretty white bicycle ringing the red bell to say hello. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Creative Movement for Ages 2 - 4
events.content: Wednesdays April 30 – June 4 and June 18 – July 23 $40 for 6-week session Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page. Description: This is a stimulating, fun and imaginative class that introduces the fundamentals of dance while nurturing a child’s agility and musicality. Students learn classroom procedures – student/teacher relationship; taking turns; participation and co-operation. By using games, props, toys and rhythm instruments, the class offers creative ways to challenge the child both mentally and physically. Instructor Bio:  Yvette Keyes was born and raised in Des Moines, IA and received her dance education at Carol Tetmeyer Dance Studio. She began teaching competitive level dancing at the John R Grubb branch of the YMCA in 2002. Her team went on to win several special judges awards and choreography awards. In the fall of 2002 she went into business for herself opening up Yvette’s Dance Studio. At Yvette’s Dance Studio she taught tap, ballet, jazz, hip-hop, contemporary and basic tumbling to dancers ages 3 and up. She also continued to expand her competition team winning the top award for large groups at Talent On Parade in 2006. She was the first large group to ever claim that award over all the other disciplines of dance with a hip-hop number. Along with teaching at her own studio she also choreographed for Meredith Middle School, Roosevelt High Schools Sensational Elite Dance Team and North High School Dance Team. Her dancers have been seen performing at their annual recital and outside performances as well at I’ll Make Me a World in Iowa, The Iowa State Fair, The Christmas Show at Park Fair Mall. Yvette has also volunteered her time teaching students at the Boys & Girls Club and other various organizations. Yvette is currently owner of Diamond Dance Center and still teaching dance. Yvette continues to attend an annual teacher conference in Chicago, IL yearly to update her teaching skills and get new ideas for the business side of her studio. Her passion for dance makes her determined to continue to pass the love of dance onto generations to come. Ages: 2-4 Years Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Painting with Acrylics I
events.content: Wednesdays May 14 – June 18 6:30 – 8:00pm Cost: $115 for six-week session Students Should Bring: Supply lists will be sent to registered students in advance of class Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Description: Students will learn fundamental techniques of acrylic painting. Any skill level can benefit from this class, from beginner to advanced. Students will learn techniques using the brush and other tools to apply paint, as well as how to mix and use color. By the end of the class students will have completed a painting based on the subject matter and style of their choosing. Instructor Bio:  Bill Hamilton was born in Des Moines, IA in 1976 to two professional nationally recognized artists, Gene and Carlie Hamilton. He attended the Academy of Art in San Francisco and mentored with artist Jim Buckels.  He has shown work in several solo exhibitions and group exhibitions in the U.S. and abroad since 2000 starting with his first solo exhibition of paintings in the Republic of Georgia.  Bill has also done murals for private homes and businesses such as Holiday Inn, Special Olympics, Des Moines Arts Festival and more.  He has taught art all over central Iowa over the years for kids and adults. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Everything Circus
events.content: May 7 – June 11 Wednesdays 7:00 - 8:30pm Cost: $20 drop-in, 6-week session for $110 Registration: Drop-in at door only.  Register for full course by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Students should bring: Athletic shoes and clothes that are easy to move in. Description: Want to learn amazing new skills and invigorate your fitness routine? Perfect for adults of all ages and fitness levels. Circus is a great way to improve body balance, strength, flexibility, and coordination. Your body AND mind will get a work out! We will explore several varieties of circus props and apparatus from juggling, to hula hooping, acrobatics and even aerial arts! This is great way to learn a little bit of everything circus.  No experience is necessary, simply a curiosity for all things circus. Classes are individualized to your needs and strengths. Come and learn circus arts right here in Des Moines from a real full-time circus performer. Space is limited. Those who pre-register will be given preference. Instructor Bio: It started innocently enough- learning to juggle for a middle school play in her small Iowa hometown. Several years later, Laura has become an international award-winning performer that has made a career out of her passion for entertaining and teaching. She has taught Circus Arts all over the world, from mission trips in Guatemala, to After School Programs in Washing D.C., and the Circus Smirkus Youth Circus. Laura has years of experience teaching all ages and levels of skill and is dedicated to providing safe and professional circus instruction. Ages: 16 and up Qestions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: American Tribal Style® Belly Dance Level 2
events.content: Twelve-week course taught in two sessions: May 15 – June 19, July 10 – August 14 Times: Thursdays 7:30 – 8:30pm Cost: $15 drop-in or $60 for six-week session Registration: Drop-in payment at door only.  Full session registration at door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" in upper right corner of this page. Students should bring: Snug-fitting, comfortable clothes Description: In Level 2 we will add to and expand upon the foundation moves that were learned in level 1 by layering, levels, new moves, new zill patterns, and performance techniques that will really get students dancing.  Students will need to have completed two sessions of level 1 or have the consent of the instructor to enter level 2. Level 2 contains twelve weeks of instruction, which will be held in two six-week sessions. All classes are taught by a certified instructor and FCBD® Sister Studio. Instructor Bio:  Dawn Grey is an American Tribal Style® Belly Dancer, Certified Instructor, Fat Chance Belly Dance® Sister Studio, and the Director of Blissful Sunrise Belly Dance. She has had a love of dance almost since before she could walk.  She has been trained in ballet, tap, and jazz dance throughout her childhood, teens, and as a dance major in college.  Then life stepped in.  She is a devoted wife and mother of two who stopped dancing to get a job with health insurance.  Fourteen years later she realized something was missing.  It was then that she found ATS® Belly Dance and fell in love.  She has not stopped since and loves to share her passion with others. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Lunch Hour Yoga
events.content: Tuesdays and Thursdays beginning April 10 Times: 12:00 – 12:45pm Cost: $10 drop-in, 5 for $45, or 10 for $80 Students Should Bring: Yoga Mats Registration: Drop-in payment at door only.   Five and Ten Class Packs available at door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Description: Join us on your lunch hour for a rejuvenating 45 minute yoga session. Geared toward all levels, this class is intended to wake up your senses and energize you for the afternoon. Instructors:  Elise Goodmann (Tuesdays), Mary Lasky (Thursdays) Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: American Tribal Style® Belly Dance - Level 1
events.content: American Tribal Style® Belly Dance Current Session: February 6 - March 20 (extended one week to account for weather cancelation) Upcoming Sessions:  Thursday, March 27 - Thursday, May 1 May 15 - June 19 July 10 - August 14 Times: Thursdays 6:15 – 7:15pm Cost: $15 drop-in or $60 for six-week session Registration: www.midwestix.securemytix.com/event/AmericanTribalStyleBellyDance Students should bring: Snug-fitting, comfortable clothes Description: This six-week session is for students who have never tried ATS® Belly Dance or for advanced students who want to refine their foundational moves.  This dance style was originated by Carolena Nericcio-Bohlman right here in the United States.  The combination of colorful costumes, adornments, coordinated movements, and a totally improvisational style, make this dance a fun and exciting venture. This class is appropriate for any ages (18-118), all sizes and fitness levels.  No prior dance experience is needed and no, you are not required to show your belly.  All you need is a willingness to learn, meet great people, and to have a lot of fun.  We will have you dancing in your very first class. Instructor Bio:  Dawn Grey is an American Tribal Style® Belly Dancer, Certified Instructor, Fat Chance Belly Dance® Sister Studio, and the Director of Blissful Sunrise Belly Dance. She has had a love of dance almost since before she could walk.  She has been trained in ballet, tap, and jazz dance throughout her childhood, teens, and as a dance major in college.  Then life stepped in.  She is a devoted wife and mother of two who stopped dancing to get a job with health insurance.  Fourteen years later she realized something was missing.  It was then that she found ATS® Belly Dance and fell in love.  She has not stopped since and loves to share her passion with others. FAQ’s: Q: Am I too old, large, out of shape, etc., etc. for belly dance? A: Absolutely not.  This dance is appropriate for all.  I have had students of all shapes and sizes and students in their twenties as well as students in their seventies.  If you have thought about it and then talked yourself out of it for any reason, now is your chance to give it a whirl in a fun and supportive environment.  If you have health concerns, we ask that your consult your physician before participating in any physical activity, but generally we can make modifications to suit your needs. Q: What should I wear/bring to class? A: You should wear something comfortable that you can move in.  Generally yoga pants or sweats with a tank top or snug fitting T-shirt are fine.  If you like you can wear a long flowing skirt. We usually dance barefoot, but if you need or want shoes, you will need some that do not have too much traction (dance shoes are good) and have not been worn outside in order to protect the integrity of the dance floor. Bring a water bottle for hydration and by week 3 you will need a set of zills (finger cymbals).  We will talk about this more on the first day of class. Q: Do I have to dance in front of other people? A: Well, there most likely will be other students, and of course, the instructor in your class; however, other than that, no.  There will be performance opportunities available for students who want to go that route, but you never have to perform if you do not want to.  Some people are content to just come to class once a week, have a great time, dance off some stress, and then get on with the rest of their lives.  That is perfectly ok. Questions? Email info@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: WERQ™
events.content: Two Sessions: May 10 – June 28 and July 12 – August 30 FREE Trial Class Saturday May 3 Times: Saturdays 8:30 – 9:30am Cost: $15 dropin or $96 for eight-week session Students Should Bring: Supportive shoes and comfortable clothes you can move in Registration: Drop-in at door only.  Full session registration at door or by clicking "Buy Tickets" at the top of this page. Description: WERQ™ is the fiercely fun dance fitness workout class based on pop, rock, and hip-hop music taught by Certified Fitness Professionals.  The signature WERQ™ warmup previews the dance steps used in class and the signature WERQ™ cooldown includes balance and yoga inspired poses.  Are you ready to WERQ™? Instructor Bio:  Caeli is a certified personal trainer and fitness instructor with over 14 years of experience.  She loves working with a wide variety of clients and teaching a huge variety of classes, and she's earned over 15 fitness certifications.  She believes fitness can be more than just a workout, and specializes in bringing fun, fresh fitness classes like PILOXING and WERQ to her clients in Des Moines.  Her background in dance, yoga and Pilates helped her develop a unique training style which centers around functional training methods and training smaller, accessory muscles which traditional strength training often neglects.  She's excited to bring the high energy, calorie burning and awesome music of WERQ to the Des Moines Social Club! Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Acting I and II
events.content: Name: Acting I and II Orientation Class for Students new to the Meisner technique, or to working with James (no charge for this session): Saturday, May 3 Official Dates:  Saturdays May 10 – June 28 Times: 10:00am - 1:00pm Cost: $30 drop-in or $200 for eight-week session Registration: Drop-in payment at door only. Register for all classes at http://midwestix.securemytix.com/event/ActingIandII Students should bring: NA Description: Whether you are just starting out, or a seasoned professional looking to make your work even better, this class is specifically designed to take you further toward excellence in your actor’s journey.  While based on the teachings of Sanford Meisner, the class also makes use of many other exercises, insights and perspectives, including ones drawn from the instructor’s own wide-ranging background and experience as a stage and screen actor and as a teacher of acting.  The instructor will also bring in outside professionals to share their perspectives on the craft of acting and to respond to scene work. Instructor Bio:  James Serpento is one of the founding members of Kingman Row Entertainment, and has worked in the entertainment industry across the United States for more than three decades, with several hundreds of productions for stage and screen to his credit, many of them award-winning. As a director, he numbers among his favorite projects Los Angeles’ Eclectic Company Theatre’s Landscape of the Body, which included an LA Ovation Award-nominated performance by Daphne Ashbrook of Dr. Who fame; and Two Gentlemen of Verona, which was named a “Critics Choice” by the LA Times’  Robert Koehler, who called it “an exceptionally intelligent, impassioned reading of a tricky play.”  James has also directed Kaufman and Hart’s Once in a Lifetime for the Pasadena Shakespeare Company, and many other works in regional theatres around the Midwest (including Buried Life at the Chicago Directors Festival, and All My Sons, God of Carnage and Hughie at the Repertory Theater of Iowa.) His film directing includes four short pieces and the features The Yoofo Club and Haunting Villisca (the latter having been named Best Feature at the Iowa Independent Film Festival.) As an actor, James has worked extensively in theatre, film, commercials, and industrials around the Midwest, including Chicago, Indianapolis and Des Moines. Favorite roles include de Stogumber in St. Joan at Chicago’s Bailiwick Repertory, Teach in American Buffalo, Goldberg in The Birthday Party and Eddie in Fool for Love. He appears in the pilot episode of Bluebox Limited’s medical thriller, Spread, for MTV, as well as in their short film, Impulse. Other film appearances include The Final Season, Dead Awake, Sixteen to Life, Ash and, most recently, The Night Visitor. James was selected to assist with teaching acting while a student at Iowa State University; shortly thereafter, he spent a semester at ISU as a guest instructor.  A devoted student and teacher of the principles and methods espoused by Sanford Meisner, James has continued to study and teach acting alongside his own professional acting career, as both an independent instructor and as a faculty member at several academic and other institutions (including Indiana University, where he achieved his MFA in Acting, and Valparaiso University, where he was an assistant professor.) IMPORTANT NOTE:   We have accepted students down to the age of 12 into the class, but this is more the exception than the rule.  Some of the scenes we use contain adult language and themes and, while we allow students to "switch out" language they're uncomfortable with, we don't condone it since that's not how it works "in the real world" (where you're expected to do the script as written.)  Even if some students switch out language, others don't, so there's a likelihood that strong language will be heard (even if you're not the one saying it.)  If this is too great a difficulty for you, we certainly understand, but the class is not for you. Questions? Contact education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Charcoal Drawing
events.content: Saturdays May 10 - July 19 1:00 - 3:00pm (no class July 5) Cost: $200 for 10 week session Students Should Bring: Supply list will be sent to registered students in advance of first session Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page Description:  Have you ever wanted to learn how to draw? Are you OK with getting your hands dirty? This 10 week class will introduce you to basic drawing concepts and techniques with a focus on the use of charcoals and related mediums. Taught by local artist, Robert Reeves, you will learn to draw from observation using simple objects, complex still life arrangements, and live models. Open to all experience levels. Instructor Bio:  Robert Reeves was born in 1970 to a desperate runaway who sold him to gypsies who in turn traded him for a bag of seed corn, some magic beans, and a carton of Kools to a lovely couple from Waterloo, Iowa who raised him as their own.  He thus began his life in much the same way he was destined to live it: going several directions at once.  He received a BA in Art from the University of Northern Iowa in 1994 all while pursuing interests in film, theater, and music.  He has been creating and exhibiting Art for over 18 years. Working primarily from photos taken while chronicling his time spent walking and traveling Reeves draws and paints moments of personal significance and striking balance.  His painting style employs rough, energetic handling of the medium, deep contrasts, and highly saturated colors.  Scenes that appear to be photographic from a distance dissolve into masses of fervent brush strokes and splotches of paint. Building facades become washes. Figures become a slash of brush.  While the finished works appear to be plausibly genuine his process for arriving at the final composition is more organic: shifting figures and structures around to match the memory of the moment rather than remain fully within the constrains of reproduction. He seeks to move beyond the source and delve into his memory and emotions from the moment and bring it to the viewer. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Hip Hop Starz
events.content: Saturdays May 3 – June 7 and June 21 – July 26 1:30 – 2:30pm $50 for 6-week session Agest 5 and up Registration: In person at DMSC or by clicking the "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page Description: Hip Hop is a blend of today's high-energy "street style" movement.  Typically performed to "popular urban music," this style of dance has been very sought after by teens, preteens and the "young at heart."  The style boasts that everyone is capable of taking part and having fun!  Sometimes percussive and other times it incorporates "house or club" dancing, making Hip Hop the latest dance phenomenon. Instructor Bio:  Yvette Keyes was born and raised in Des Moines, IA and received her dance education at Carol Tetmeyer Dance Studio. She began teaching competitive level dancing at the John R Grubb branch of the YMCA in 2002. Her team went on to win several special judges awards and choreography awards. In the fall of 2002 she went into business for herself opening up Yvette’s Dance Studio. At Yvette’s Dance Studio she taught tap, ballet, jazz, hip-hop, contemporary and basic tumbling to dancers ages 3 and up. She also continued to expand her competition team winning the top award for large groups at Talent On Parade in 2006. She was the first large group to ever claim that award over all the other disciplines of dance with a hip-hop number. Along with teaching at her own studio she also choreographed for Meredith Middle School, Roosevelt High Schools Sensational Elite Dance Team and North High School Dance Team. Her dancers have been seen performing at their annual recital and outside performances as well at I’ll Make Me a World in Iowa, The Iowa State Fair, The Christmas Show at Park Fair Mall. Yvette has also volunteered her time teaching students at the Boys & Girls Club and other various organizations. Yvette is currently owner of Diamond Dance Center and still teaching dance. Yvette continues to attend an annual teacher conference in Chicago, IL yearly to update her teaching skills and get new ideas for the business side of her studio. Her passion for dance makes her determined to continue to pass the love of dance onto generations to come.   Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Dance Trance
events.content: Ongoing beginning Tuesday, May 6 Times: Tuesdays and Fridays 6:00 – 7:00pm, Saturdays 3:00 – 4:00pm Cost: $12 drop-in or 12 classes for $125 Students Should Bring: water, a towel, and wear dance/workout gear and tennis shoes. Registration: Drop-in payment at door only.  12 class packs available at door or at http://midwestix.securemytix.com/event/DanceTrance Description: Dance Trance is a choreographed class that includes dance combinations and cardio moves so that you “sweat it” while you “shake it”! The purpose of this class is to get a great workout AND lose yourself in the rhythm.  It's not just exercise...it fills your soul!  You can tone and shape, build your cardiovascular endurance, and lose weight all while picking up some new dance moves! We consider our dance style more street dance and do not follow traditional dance standards or techniques. For that reason, students do not need to have a dance background, just determination and commitment to progress in a Dance Trance class. The more classes you attend the quicker you’ll learn the choreography!  You won't find another class where you have more fun while you're working out!  This class is for people who LOVE to dance.  More information at https://www.facebook.com/dancetrancedesmoines?ref=hl and http://dancetrancefitness.com/desmoines/ Instructor Bio:  Jamie Shae is a mother of two, a native Iowan and an artist at heart.  As Jamie continued to seek ways to be healthy in mind, body, and spirit, she came across Dance Trance Fitness and knew instantly this was something special.  Jamie has always been an athlete - everything from gymnastics, dance, softball, to kickboxing - but she never really loved working out until she found Dance Trance Fitness.  Now she wants to share her newfound love with others to create a community of men and women supporting each other, both on and off the dance floor. Ages: Recommended for 16 and up.  Some music contains explicit lyrics. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Ballet Sculpt
events.content: Two Sessions: May 11 – June 29 and July 13 – August 31 FREE Trial Class Sunday May 4 Times: Sundays 9:00 – 10:00am Cost: $15 drop-in or $79 for eight-week session Students Should Bring: Socks, ballet slippers or soft soled dance shoes and a yoga mat. Registration: Drop in at door only.  Full session registration at door or through "Buy Tickets" link at the top of this page. Description: Unleash your inner dancer and join us for a workout which will help you sculpt a longer, leaner you.  This ballet-inspired workout will help you develop your best body by stretching and working your muscles from head to toe.  Breath, stretch and flow through a workout which combines ballet, Pilates, body weight toning and more.  Whether you've always wished you did ballet, have spent years at the barre (or just want to look like you did), this is the perfect workout for you! Instructor Bio:  Caeli is a certified personal trainer and fitness instructor with over 14 years of experience.  She loves working with a wide variety of clients and teaching a huge variety of classes, and she's earned over 15 fitness certifications.  She believes fitness can be more than just a workout, and specializes in bringing fun, fresh fitness classes like PILOXING and WERQ to her clients in Des Moines.  Her background in dance, yoga and Pilates helped her develop a unique training style which centers around functional training methods and training smaller, accessory muscles which traditional strength training often neglects. Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org

events.name: Teen Yoga
events.content: Sundays April 6 – June 15 12:00 – 1:00pm $10/class or 5 for $35 Students Should Bring: Yoga Mats, comfortable clothes Registration: Drop-in at door only.  5 class pack available at the door or at http://midwestix.securemytix.com/event/TeenYoga Description: Bring your teen to a class designed just for them. They'll work out the kinks, find their strength, tune into that laser-sharp focus, and learn to smile while balancing all that life throws at them. Taught by Mary Lasky, RYT, owner of Santosha Yoga Des Moines, and experienced teacher of kids and teens. (If your child has had Yoga for PE at middle school, most likely it was Mary teaching.)  Mats provided and all are welcome. Inquiries welcome at 515.333.3112 or wittierone@hotmail.com. More info on kids yoga available at santoshayogadsm.vpweb.com Instructor Bio:  Mary Lasky owns Santosha Yoga Des Moines and holds 200-hr RYTe certification through Yoga Alliance and Ashtanga Teacher Certification  through master teacher, David Swenson.  In accordance with the Ashtanga tradition, she continues her studies with master teachers each year. Mary has taught adults and children across the metro for ten years and particularly enjoys her work with at-risk youth and underserved adult populations.  She values yoga as an art form that crosses boundaries and connects people by first improving one's own health and outlook, and then opening them up to help others.  "Practice and all is coming." - Sri K. Pattabhi Jois, Ashtanga Founder Ages: 12 and up or with approval Questions? Email education@desmoinessocialclub.org
